posts.content:
The Ballista of Beory (Cleric 29 / CoT 10 / Monk 1)


Image source: https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-_7lychMFP4M/ ... oncept.jpg

Build concepts and features:
I've been studying a few ranged builds and have written this build to see if a non-RDD devastating critical ranged build is viable.

I've utilised Half-Orc in this example to boost Str slightly without costing the planet, utilised Cleric for great ranged AB/damage boosts from spells such as Divine Favor/Divine Power, utilised CoT for bonus pre-epic and epic feats, and added a little Monk cheese at the end for some Wisdom AC in robes, tumble dump and evasion.

Base AB 39 ranged. HP nearly 400. Skill points are awful, but not much one can do there as a half-orc cleric. 

Dev Crit is obtained at level 24 and Dev Crit DC is 37. Could have increased the DC by 1 by taking a Great Strength but I preferred the extra AB for a +5% chance to hit and crit against comparable opponents.

Because it is a dual strength/wisdom build, it has a reasonable melee presence as a secondary attack (Base AB 35), although other builds will be better at this, the cleric boosts to AB/AC can very much compensate except in high magic environments, and mean his morning star attack might still be useful.

Spot is chosen over listen as the detection skill, not just because CoT has it as a class skill, but also because Spot is effective at all distances provided one is in visual range, whereas listen is less effective at longer distances. 

Spotting enemies doesn't incur the -4AB penalty without Blind Fight that would occur if a creature is detected with listen that I discovered recently.

Saves are surprisingly good. 

Also avoided exp penalties for essentially the entire build, which will make single player module users very happy!

I thought this build draft looked pretty nice so I've decided to share it with you guys, see if there is anything to tear down and remake again in the spirit of continuous improvement.

Other build adjustments I have considered:
Choosing Darts as the weapon would save me having to take the Rapid Reload feat and allow for uncapped strength damage, however the critical range was poor so I didn't select this. Also ammunition tends to run out quick, and crossbow provides both the magical properties of the crossbow and the ammunition.

Point Blank Shot would have been nice, along with Blind Fight but I felt extend spell is more useful in this situation (ie extended divine favor, extended divine power etc etc).

Chose Animal / Plant domains for the stronger summons (which you can buff with Barkskin + Cat's Grace) to tank damage while you blast away. Travel / Trickery would also be delightful choices, if the environment permits this.

Other single level class wonder choices instead of Monk included fighter (bonus feat), ranger (bonus feat), rogue/assassin (skills/1d6 sneak attack) but I thought Monk provided the most here.

Spellcraft would have been nice for some saves but it was tough to fit everything in.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:
Jan 14, 2020
I've been studying a few ranged builds and have written this build to see if a non-RDD devastating critical ranged build is viable.
The most obvious thing to do here is a strength based Arcane archer.
They can easily get a naked AB above +50.
They can be built with Cleric, but too many Cleric levels means less AA levels and that eats up the Enchant arrow bonus to AB and damage: Divine favor needs 15 Cleric levels for a +5 bonus. Enchant arrow only needs 9 AA levels for a +5 bonus. Divine power only adds +1 AB to a BAB 29 build.
Still I cannot deny that Cleric is a great class for many purposes.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
All good comments, I just want to call out that Divine Power offers a full melee attack for the fourth attack rather than a partial melee attack “If” applied to a sub 4 APR build.

So the attack schedule for your build at 20th level (when APR is defined) would be:
17/12/7/2 (from memory), add Divine power and it becomes: 20/15/10/5.

For the 3APR build your attack schedule would be: 15/10/5 (at 20th level). Divine Power bumps you to 20/15/10/20. There is some discussion on the value of a permanent 4 APR build vs the 3 APR plus Divine Power, but in my experience that full AB 4th attack is one of the most powerful abilities in the game and well worth the occasional Mord’s and re-application of Divine Power.

I would strongly recommend testing it out so you can see the difference it makes on end game content. Especially on a DevCrit build where it doubles down on power.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
UPDATED: Adjusted UBAB schedule AB as per comments below.  This changes offhand and free attack weapon schedules on UBAB attacks to BAB progression.  I also added a reference to "Main", "Off-hand" and "Free" to the attack schedules described below as this term is used in some of the wiki examples to provided some additional clarity.

A couple of nuances here related to how this works.  

First, Divine power "added attacks" work in the same sequence calculation as haste, flurry, rapid shot, cleaves, attacks of opportunity and tensor. They all act as an attack using a “third” hand.  We will come back to this in a second.

Second, Divine power converts all first, second and third hand attack sequences to that of an equivalent full melee BAB build subject to the +20 AB Cap.

Also, I tend to focus on the level 20 sequences because everything is decided by then with respect to BAB and more importantly APR ... meaning nothing you do after level 20 outside of not levelling will impact your final BAB.

So, if you have. 16 vs 15 BAB at level 20 (I believe these are all accurate, I have never spelled it out in this depth before but this is the way it works in my head and I believe in actuality).

Legend
First Hand (Primary) Attack Sequence: Blue
Second Hand (Off-hand) Attack Sequence: Red
Third Hand (Free) Attack Sequence: Purple


16 BAB @ level 20 (Single Wield)
Normal BAB: 16/11/6/1
Hasted BAB: 16/11/6/1/16
Rapid Shot BAB: 16/11/6/1/16 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
Haste + Rapid Shot 16/11/6/1/16/11 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
DP BAB: 20/15/10/5.      (Equivalent straight fighter progression)
DP + Rapid Shot BAB: 20/15/10/5/20 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
DP + Haste BAB: 20/15/10/5/20
DP + Haste + Rapid Shot: 20/15/10/5/20/15 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB: 16/13/10/7/4/1
UBAB + Flurry: 16/13/10/7/4/1/16 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + Haste: 16/13/10/7/4/1/16
UBAB + Haste + Flurry: 16/13/10/7/4/1/16/11 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + DP: 20/17/14/11/8/5
UBAB + DP + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/5/20(add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + DP + Haste: 20/17/14/11/8/5/20
UBAB + DP + Haste + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/5/20/15 (add -2 AB for all attacks)

15 BAB @ level 20 (Single Wield)
Normal BAB: 15/10/5
Hasted BAB: 15/10/5/15
Rapid Shot BAB: 15/10/5/15 (-2 AB for all attacks)
Haste + Rapid Shot BAB: 15/10/5/15/10 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
DP BAB: 20/15/10/20 (Equivalent Straight Fighter Progression)
DP + Rapid Shot BAB: 20/15/10/20 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
DP + Haste BAB: 20/15/10/20/15
DP + Haste + Rapid Shot BAB: 20/15/10/20/15/10 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB: 15/12/9/6/3
UBAB + Flurry: 15/12/9/6/3/15 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + Haste: 15/12/9/6/3/15
UBAB + Haste + Flurry: 15/12/9/6/3/15/10 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + DP: 20/17/14/11/8/20
UBAB + DP + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/20/15 (add -2 AB for all attacks)
UBAB + DP + Haste: 20/17/14/11/8/20/15
UBAB + DP + Haste + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/20/15/10 (add -2 AB for all attacks)

This is why I really like Kama as the Melee or alt Melee Weapon on Cl/COT/Mo builds and why I really like monk before level 40 (among many other reasons to be fair).  It is also why Divine Power monk builds are soooooo tasty,  the Wisdom AC and Zen archery are not so bad either :)

So, the Third Hand (Free) progression as you can see, is independent of One Hand (Main) and Two Hand (Off-hand) progression.

A quick dual/two weapon (kama) example with TWF/Ambi/ITWF:
16 BAB @ level 20 (Dual Wield)
UBAB + DP + Haste + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/5/20/15/20/15 (add -2 for Flurry and a further -2 for dual wielding)

15 BAB @ level 20 (Dual Wield)
UBAB + DP + Haste + Flurry: 20/17/14/11/8/20/15/20/15/10 (add -2 for Flurry and a further -2 for dual wielding)

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:
Jan 14, 2020
I've been studying a few ranged builds and have written this build to see if a non-RDD devastating critical ranged build is viable.
Hmmm, this concept has been explored a time or two and is totally viable, and I believe some are even posted in the archives (here's the Old Fish's The Devastator).  However, most use AA in order to get the AB up there.  I'm not sure how married you are to half-orc in this situation.  You may consider Half-elf, and go Cleric23/Bard2/AA15.  Or completely sell out on being a caster and go Cleric20/Bard2/AA18.  You could stop Wis at 19, maybe even drop Zen Archery and rely on Dex (maybe better if Elf, but Half-elf, meh) and then pump your Strength more to get a higher DC.  Your AB will be much higher so you could actually threaten a critical.  

As Zanithar noted in his dissertation on Divine Power and the "third hand attack", you are better served going for a 15 BAB (see the Hin Gatling Gun that did this, or really any good combat cleric build).  Will you get Morded or Dispelled? Sure.  But it's not your only casting.  If (when) I get Morded or Dispelled, that's the "oh shite" moment, so you hit your Greater Sanc button, and re-energize your energification (so not a word).  I typically run around with at least 3 or 4 DPs memorized, with an Extended one or two in my backpocket for the boss.  By level 20, your extended DP will last 32 rounds.  Coupled with an Extended Haste (also 32 rounds), and Rapid Shot, Extended Divine Favors, and all of the other Buffs, and you'll be like a mini-gun mowing down tree lines.

Cheers!
